avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Cool and mainly dry conditions will maintain a generally stable snowpack. Some exposed slopes will be firm and icy. A breakable crust will exist in more sheltered locations. Isolated areas of windslab and any remaining cornices, mainly affecting summit gullies, will require care and attention.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: GC11/3 Cool+dry old snow generally stable+icy in places isolated patches windslab+cornices require attention avalanche hazard low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Mainly dry and cool conditions will continue to affect the area. Winds will be generally from an East-South-Easterly direction. Winds will be fresh initially by morning decreasing to moderate through the day. Summit temperatures will be in the region of -1 to -2 degrees Celsius. A few light snow showers may affect the area towards the end of the day but these are not expected to be significant.
Observed Weather Influences: Cool winds have been mainly fresh, generally from an Easterly direction. It has been mostly dry. Summit temperatures today were around -2 to -3 degrees Celsius.
ObservedSnowStability: Cool and dry conditions are maintaining good general snowpack stability. Isolated pockets of windslab exist in wind sheltered locations but these are generally insignificant in depth. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Little change is expected in the snowpack. It will continue to be generally well bonded and stable. A few shallow and isolated patches of windslab will be found on mainly West to North aspects above 1000 metres.  These will be easily avoidable. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: CM for 11.3  Snowpack generally stable. A few shallow, isolated and avoidable patches of windslab above 1000m. Low hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: It is expected to remain cloudy but mainly dry throughout. South-Easterly winds will gradually ease through the period. The freezing level will be around 800 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: It was a cloudy but generally dry day with a fresh South-Easterly breeze. The freezing level was around 900 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: A few shallow patches of windslab can be found on mainly West to North aspects above 1000 metres. These are isolated and avoidable. Otherwise the snowpack is well consolidated and generally stable. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The vast majority of the snow will be well bonded and stable. Areas exposed to the wind will be firm and often icy. Isolated pockets of softer, less well bonded snow may be encountered in steep, wind sheltered locations on West to North aspects above 900 metres. Gully tops and around sharply defined corrie rims are the locations where you are most likely to encounter these conditions. Small cornices will be present above these aspects. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC for 11.03  Mostly well bonded snow. Isolated pockets softer snow - wind sheltered locations - W to N aspects abv 900m. Av Haz Low

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Dry conditions are expected during the day. Winds will be fresh Easterly, easing to become moderate East-South-Easterly by early afternoon. Freezing level will rise from 700 metres overnight, to become 800 metres later in the day.
Observed Weather Influences: Low cloud and very light precipitation, falling as snow above 750 metres. Moderate East-South-Easterly winds. Freezing level around 800 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: The majority of snow is well bonded and stable, with areas exposed to the wind, firm and often icy. Isolated pockets of softer, less well bonded snow, persist in wind sheltered locations only, on mainly West to North aspects above 900 metres. Small cornices are also present above these slopes.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Little change is expected to the snowpack which will be firm and stable throughout. Any new snow will be largely insignificant. Greatest snow cover will be in the mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges, with most accumulations on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 700 metres, particularly in gullies, coire back walls and below coire rims. Coastal ranges mostly bare with only snow remnants on same aspects. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: To for 11.3. Most snow cover inland. Generally firm and stable throughout, greatest amounts on N,NE,E asps abv 700m. Haz Low

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Winds remaining fresh to strong generally East-South-Easterly, easing in strength towards the end of the day. A mostly dry period is expected, but with some precipitation later in the afternoon falling as sleet or snow above 800 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: Winds strong to gale force Easterlies. A dry day with summit temperatures around -2 deg C.
ObservedSnowStability: All remaining snow is firm, stable and icy although softening later in afternoon. Greatest snow cover is mostly in mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges and on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 700 metres. Most accumulations are present in gullies and coire back walls and below coire rims. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Overall the snowpack will be firm and stable. Instabilities will still exist on West through North to North-East aspects above 1000 metres where accumulations have gained depth. Areas most affected will be very steep wind sheltered locations such as convex slopes, gully tops, crag aprons and coire rims. Cornices will be found on these same aspects. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 11/03 Snow stability generally good but instabilities persist on W, NW, N and NE aspects above 1000m. Cornices. Haz Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: It will be a dry day. Strong winds from the South-East will slowly ease through the day becoming moderate in strength. The snow surface will remain cold above 600 metres despite a higher freezing level.
Observed Weather Influences: Winds were very strong from the East-South-East. A mainly dry day with the freezing level around 700 metres at noon.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is firm and well bonded in most locations. Instabilities within the snowpack are present on West through North to North-East aspects above 1000 metres. Areas most affected are steep wind sheltered locations such as gully tops, crag aprons, coire rims and convex slopes. Cornices are present on these same aspects.  The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The snowpack will be generally well bonded, icy and stable. Some isolated areas of windslab will be present in wind sheltered locations on mainly West through North to North-East aspects above 1000 metres. Gully tops and scarp slopes will be most affected. These accumulations are not expected to be significant and will be mostly avoidable. Firm cornices will overhang many of the same aspects. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: LO for 11.03 Generally good stability. Small isolated deposits of windslab on W-N-NE aspects above 1000m. cornices remain. Haz Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Fresh to strong East-South-East winds will decrease to moderate and veer to become South-East during the afternoon. Trace amounts of snow are expected later in the day. Summit temperatures will be around -3 degrees C.
Observed Weather Influences: Light snow showers on strong East-South-East winds. Cloudy on the tops with freezing level around 800 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is firm and icy with a surface crust in many locations, giving good general stability. Isolated deposits of windslab are present in some wind sheltered locations on various aspects above 1000 metres. These are mostly shallow and avoidable. The avalanche hazard is Low.
